bmi.calculator 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    • bmi.calculator

    Calculate caloric intake per day based in a target weight. Assumption is that the goal is losing weight rather than gaining weight.

    project_calories.Rd

    Calculate caloric intake per day based in a target weight. Assumption is that the goal is losing weight rather than gaining weight.

    project_calories(
  weight,
  height,
  sex,
  age,
  pal,
  target_weight,
  number_of_days,
  return_graph = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    weight

    A numeric number of current weight in kilograms (kg).

    height

    A numeric number of current height in meters (m).

    sex

    A numeric number for sex, used in the Harris–Benedict equation estimation, 1 for male and 2 for female

    age

    A numeric number for current age in years.

    pal

    A numeric number for physical activity level, can only be one of the four listed values: 1.2 for "Little/no exercise" 1.4 for "Light exercise 1-3 times a week" 1.6 for "Moderate exercise 3-5 times a week" 1.75 for "Hard exercise 3-5 times a week"

    target_weight

    A numeric number for weight goal to be achieved in number_of_days

    number_of_days

    A numeric number for number of days allotted to achieve target_weight

    return_graph

    TRUE or FALSE on whether to return a graphical visualization instead of a caloric intake value.

    Value

    A float or a ggplot visualization. If return_graph is False, returns a float specifying caloric intake divided by the number of days. If return_graph is True, returns a straight line graph of projected weight loss per day.

    Examples

    project_calories(100, 1.85, 1, 25, 1.6, 75, 25, return_graph=FALSE)
#> [1] 2417.04
2417.04
#> [1] 2417.04
